nodes.speaker: Loki
nodes.text: Three red checks. In my hall. Do you know what that makes you, {name}? Not “good.” Not “pure.” Just… unfinished.

choices.label: I did what I thought was right.

nodes.speaker: Loki
nodes.text: Right is a lullaby for children. Dreadheim doesn’t sleep. Dreadheim watches. So I won’t reward you… I’ll correct you.

choices.label: I won’t become what you want.

nodes.speaker: Loki
nodes.text: You will—because you’re going to repeat Hel’s little test… but this time the targets are Dreadheim’s own citizens. If you can’t break strangers, you’ll learn to break neighbors.

choices.label: What do I have to do?

nodes.speaker: Loki
nodes.text: Three marks again. Three outcomes. No speeches. No mercy. You’ll do each task in Dreadheim City—then come back here when your journal shows all three decisions.

nodes.speaker: Loki
nodes.text:
Here’s your correction:

• **Mark One:** Take something from a citizen—and make them believe they deserved it.
• **Mark Two:** Force a citizen to betray a friend. A whisper. A lie. A planted fear.
• **Mark Three:** Hurt their pride without lifting a blade. Make them thank you for it.

When you’re done, your journal will show three marks. Then you return to me.

nodes.speaker: Loki
nodes.text: Refuse? Fine. Stay soft. But understand this: Dreadheim will still shape you—only it won’t be gentle about it. Go. Before I get bored.
